faqs.question: What are the admission requirements for GNDEC?
faqs.answer: The admission requirements may vary each year. Generally, admission to GNDEC is based on entrance exams such as JEE Main, followed by counseling conducted by the college or state authorities.

faqs.question: Does GNDEC provide hostel facilities?
faqs.answer: Yes, GNDEC provides separate hostel facilities for both male and female students.

faqs.question: What extracurricular activities are available at GNDEC?
faqs.answer: GNDEC encourages students to participate in a wide range of extracurricular activities, including sports, cultural events, technical competitions, and various student clubs.

faqs.question: Does GNDEC have industry collaborations?
faqs.answer: Yes, GNDEC has established collaborations with various industries and organizations to provide students with internship opportunities, industrial training, and placements.

faqs.question: Is there a placement cell at GNDEC?
faqs.answer: Yes, GNDEC has an active placement cell that assists students in securing job placements by organizing campus recruitment drives, inviting companies for placements, and providing training for interviews.

faqs.question: What are the facilities available on the GNDEC campus?
faqs.answer: GNDEC offers state-of-the-art infrastructure, including well-equipped laboratories, a library, auditoriums, sports facilities, cafeteria, and modern classrooms.

faqs.question: Does GNDEC organize technical events and conferences?
faqs.answer: Yes, GNDEC organizes various technical events, workshops, seminars, and conferences to foster innovation, knowledge-sharing, and skill development among students and faculty.

faqs.question: Who is the principal of the college
What is the tentative date for direct counseling and how to apply for it
faqs.answer:
The tentative date for announcement of direct counseling in GNDEC is Mid of June. A notification regarding this will be put on the website of this college and an advertisement will also be given in the leading newspaper of the state. For participating in direct
            counseling candidate has to enroll online on the direct admission portal of this college (this
            portal will be active only after the announcement of direct admission) and then
            send/submit by hand the hard copy of filled form along with demand draft of direct fee in
            the academic section of GNDEC

faqs.question: What is the detail of various courses of B.Tech and intake in each course in GNDEC?
faqs.answer: Detail of various courses along with intake can be obtained from the following link:www.gndec.ac.in/sites/default/files/Courses_1.pdf

faqs.question: What are eligibility criteria for admission to B.Tech first year?
faqs.answer:
Eligibility Criteria
            a) As per Punjab Government Notification 13/105/10-1TE2/700595 dated: 01/03/2016
            eligibility criteria for admission to 1st year B.Tech. course is as under:-
            For Engineering & Technology Courses
            All Those candidates who have passed the 10+2 examination from a board recognized or
            established by central/state government through legislation with Physics and Mathematics as
            compulsory subjects along with one of the following subjects:
            i) Chemistry
            ii) Biotechnology
            iii) Computer Science and
            iv) Biology
            Those candidates who have passed diploma in any engineering Trade from Punjab State Board of
            Technical Education and Industrial Training, Chandigarh or Sant Longowal Institute of Engineering and
            Technology, Longowal (SLIET), or any such examination from any other recognized board of Technical
            Education.
            OR
            The candidate who have passed two years certificate from Sant Longowal Institute of Engineering and
            Technology, Lonogowal (SLIET) shall be eligible.

faqs.question: What are eligibility criteria for admission to B.Tech. Second year (LEET)?
faqs.answer:
For B.Tech. (Lateral Entry) as per Punjab Government notification no. 8/40/2013-
            1TE2/742157/1 dated 28.04.2016
            For Engineering: The minimum qualification for admission to 2nd year (3rd semester) of B.Tech. curses
            shall be as follows:-
            I. All those students who have passed Diploma examnation from an AICTE approved institution and
            have obtained at least 45 % marks (40% in case of candidateds belonging to resered category) in
            appropriated branch of Engineering/ Technology shall be eligible to apply.
            II. All those candidated who have passed B.Sc. Degree from a recognised University as defined by
            UGC with at least 45% marks (40% in case of candidates belonging to reserve category) and
            passed XII standard with mathematics as a subject shall be eligible to apply.
            a) Students, who have passed B.Sc. Degree from a recognised University by UGC, shall clear
            the subject of Engineering Graphics / Engineering drawing courses as defined and Engineering
            Mechanics of the first year engineering programe along with 2nd year subjects.
            III. It is further provided that studnets, who have passed Diploma in Engineering & Technology from
            an AICTE approved Institution for B.Sc. Degree from a recognised University as defined by the UGC, shall
            also be eligible for admission to the first year of Eningeering. This shall be considered only after the
            vacancy at lateral entry are exahusted.

faqs.question:
What is the eligibility criteria and basic requirements for admission under fee waiver
            scheme to B.Tech First year and B.Tech second year
faqs.answer:
All Institutions affiliated to I.K. Gujral Punjab Technical University and Maharaja Ranjit
            Singh State Technical University shall follow “Fee Waiver Scheme” as prescribed by AICTE
            and notified by Government of Punjab vide its notification no. 13/60/08-1TE2/1797, dated
            23rd May, 2011 and notification no. 13/60/08/1TE2/2007 dated 31.05.2012. Other
            Institutions/Universities may notify their respective fee waiver scheme separately.
            These notifications are available on the IKG-PTU website at the following link:
            https://ptu.ac.in/admnotifi.aspx as well as on the website of GNDEC

faqs.question: .What are the rules for adjustment/refund of fees?
faqs.answer:
RULES FOR ADJUSTMENT | REFUND OF FEES
            As per Notification No. 13/105/2010-1TE2/314 Dated: 28-01-2011 and Notification No.:
            13/105/2011-1TE2/325 dated 28-01-2011:-
            (a) In case a student changes his/her college/ University during centralized counselling
            conducted by IKGPTU his/her fee shall be refunded by the previous Institution after
            deduction of Rs. 1000/-only and the original documents will be returned immediately.
            (b) In case a student surrenders his/her seat within 7 days of the end of the online counselling he _ she must submit application to the college and register online on IKGPTU website
            www.ptuadmissions.nic.in. IKGPTU shall only forward such cases to the concerned
            colleges/Universities and colleges must refund his/her full fee after deduction of Rs.
            1000/-only.
